items.item:
A woman has 7 children, half of them are boys.
How can this be possible?
[Answer]They are all boys.[/Answer]

What lies in bed, and stands in bed,
First white, then red.
The plumper it gets
The better the old woman likes it?
[Answer]A strawberry[/Answer]

Lighter than what I am made of,
More of me is hidden than is seen,
I am the bane of the mariner,
A tooth within the sea.
Speak my name.
[Answer]Ice[/Answer]

I get wetter the more I dry, what am I?
[Answer]A towel[/Answer]

The man who built it,
Doesn't want it for himself.
The man who bought it,
Doesn't need it for himself.
The man who needs it, Doesn't know it when he does.
[Answer]A coffin[/Answer]

A spirited jig, it dances bright,
Banishing all but darkest night,
Give it food and it will live;
Give it water and it will die.
[Answer]Fire[/Answer]

I am free for the taking through all of your life,
Though given but once at birth.
I am less than nothing in weight,
But will fell the strongest of you if held.
[Answer]Breath[/Answer]

What has four wheels and flies?
[Answer]The town garbage wagon[/Answer]

What has four legs in the morning,
Two legs in the afternoon,
And three legs at night?
[Answer]A human being[/Answer]

No sooner spoken than broken. What is it?
[Answer]Silence[/Answer]

We are very little creatures; all of us have different features. One of us in glass is set; one of us you'll find in jet. Another you may see in tin, and a fourth is boxed within. If the fifth you should pursue, it can never fly from you. What are we?
[Answer]A, E, I, O, and U[/Answer]

Where can you find roads without cars,
forests without trees,
and cities without buildings?
[Answer]A map[/Answer]

Cannot be seen, cannot be felt,
cannot be heard, cannot be smelt.
It lies behind the stars and beneath the hills.
Ends life and daytime kills.
[Answer]Darkness[/Answer]

This thing runs but cannot walk,
sometimes sings but never talks.
Lacks arms, has hands;
lacks a head has a face.
[Answer]a clock[/Answer]

Man walks over;
Man walks under;
In time of war
He burns asunder.
[Answer]A bridge[/Answer]

Walk on the living and they do not mumble.
Walk on the dead, they mutter and grumble.
[Answer]Leaves[/Answer]

With no wings, I fly.
With no eyes, I see.
With no arms, I climb.
More frightening than any beast,
Stronger than any foe.
I am cunning, ruthless and tall;
In the end, I rule all.
[Answer]Imagination[/Answer]

Without a body, yet I have a head and a tail.
[Answer]A coin[/Answer]

It's a part of heaven yet it thouches the Earth.
Some say it's valuable, others say it has no worth.
[Answer]A rainbow[/Answer]

What three letters turn a boy into a man?
[Answer]Age[/Answer]

What crosses a river yet never moves?
[Answer]A bridge[/Answer]

What runs smoother than any rhyme,
Loves to fall yet cannot climb?
[Answer]Water[/Answer]

What is always too late?
[Answer]Regret[/Answer]

What can travel the world while stuck in a corner?
[Answer]A stamp[/Answer]

How many months have 29 days?
[Answer]All of them[/Answer]

What can run but never walks,
Has a mouth but never talks,
Has a bed but never sleeps,
Has a head but never weeps?
[Answer]A river[/Answer]

When first I appear, I seem mysterious,
But when I’m explained, I’m nothing serious
[Answer]A riddle[/Answer]

Alive without breath,
As cold as death;
Never thirsty, ever drinking,
All in mail never clinking.
[Answer]A fish[/Answer]

What has roots as nobody sees,
Is taller than trees.
Up, up it goes,
And yet it never grows?
[Answer]A mountain[/Answer]

What is greater than God,
More evil than the devil,
The poor have it,
The rich need it,
and if you eat it, you will die?
[Answer]Nothing[/Answer]

A house of red carrying babies aplenty,
Lies within a house of white that
Lies within a house of green. What is it?
[Answer]A watermelon[/Answer]

If you have me, you want to share me.
If you share me you haven't got me.
[Answer]A secret[/Answer]

I am given from one to another,
Yet I cannot be held.
I cannot be held,
Yet I can be broken.
[Answer]A promise[/Answer]

Forward I am heavy, but backwards I am not.
[Answer]A ton[/Answer]

He has married many women, yet he has never been married. Who is he?
[Answer]A priest[/Answer]

What can you have but not hold,
Catch but not throw?
[Answer]A cold[/Answer]

A man rides into town on Friday, stays for three nights and leaves town on Friday. How is this?
[Answer]His horse's name is Friday[/Answer]

What happens once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a million years?
[Answer]The letter M[/Answer]

What is full of holes yet still holds water?
[Answer]A sponde[/Answer]

Pronounced as one letter,
And written with three,
Two letters there are,
And two only in me.
I'm double, I'm single,
I'm black, blue, and gray,
I'm read from both ends, And the same either way. What am I?
[Answer]Eye[/Answer]

The more you take away, the larger I become.
[Answer]A hole[/Answer]

What has three feet but has no legs?
[Answer]A yardstick[/Answer]
